intro: Sommieria leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf sommieria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
